title: Worked Solution
text:
Based on the emission line spectra shown in the first image and the energy-level diagrams provided in the second image, option $$	extbf{b}$$ is the correct answer because the pattern of energy levels corresponds to the emission lines in the spectrum.
Hereâ€™s why:
-The emission lines represent transitions between energy levels. The more lines present, the more energy levels involved in the transitions.
-In the spectrum, there are three blue lines followed by a red line. This suggests that there are four transitions, with one being of higher energy (red shift).
-In energy-level diagram $$	extbf{b}$$, the evenly spaced lines match the four distinct energy levels that would account for the transitions seen in the spectrum.
This alignment confirms that the transitions are accurately represented in energy-level diagram $$	extbf{b}$$.
